item.description:
Fireworks for sale flyposter on lamp column opp 436 Croydon Rd Beckenham at the junction with the War Memorial roundabout. Retailer is in Bromley Rd, Bromley, I think. Seen from moving vehicle so no photo. Seen Saturday 1/11/25.

item.title: Junction between Murray street, Augustines Road, and Agar Grove, 2nd November
item.description:
Street lights on the agar Grove bridge are still not working, despite the fact that the works were completed nearly 4 months ago. Zebra crossing lights outside of Nisa store not working either. This is hazardous and the council does not take action despite many messages highlighting this potential hazard. Please take action and fix our street lights.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St. Augustine's Road, Kentish Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Short silver, square cross section cabinet fronting 1, Central Parade, High Street Penge. Tags on top surface. This is situated on the public footway and so is likely to be related to Highways not the Record Shop.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Penge, London

item.description:

item.title: Fallen tree outside number 38, 2nd November
item.description:
The young tree planted in the grass verge outside 38 Chaucer Road was knocked over by a delivery van who reversed into it on Saturday 1/11/25. The tree is lying on the grass and is not a danger to vehicles or pedestrians.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 36, Chaucer Road, Albany Park, Sidcup, London

item.title: Beckenham Green antisocial behaviour - one man regularly visiting Beckenham Green and playing an amplified music device so loud it can be heard from every point in the Park, spoiling the peace and littering., 2nd November
item.description:
Beckenham Green antisocial behaviour - one man regularly visiting Beckenham Green and playing an amplified music device so loud it can be heard from every point in the Park, spoiling the peace and littering. Previously seen on two days in the summer, and now seen again on Saturday 1/11/25 at 15:37 staying for before and beyond my 15 minute visit. He also threw his drink can over his shoulder onto the grass (visible in the photos upright on the ground, in his hand, and then on the grass by the LH bench end. He does a continuous rocking motion perhaps indicative of mental illness.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albemarle Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Flyposted blue A4 advertisement and expired ad for the annual Bromley Park User Satisfaction survey on the chestnut paling fence in Beckenham Green, High St frontage, about 3m from the footway, near St George's Church. Conservation Area

item.title: Spray tags on the brick pillars of the Vicar's Oak Gate of Crystal Palace Park at the jct of Crystal Palace Parade and Anerley Hill., 2nd November
item.description:
Spray tags on the brick pillars of the Vicar's Oak Gate of Crystal Palace Park at the jct of Crystal Palace Parade and Anerley Hill. Conservation Area. Regarding the annoying pop up box on Bromley Fix My Street, I am sadly fully aware that Bromley Council has disposed of CPP to an unelected, unaccountable, self-perpetuating 11 person Quango, the CPP Trust. However Bromley Council provides grafitti removal free to victims where it is visible from the street. I am so requesting this removal. Please reprogram Bromley FMS to allow grafitti removal to be reported without thus annoying pop up box and barrier to proceeding further.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Anerley Hill, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Request a litter bin to be installed, 2nd November
item.description:
There is an ongoing issue with littering around the junction of blithdale road and Brodrick grove. The installation of a litter bin would help alleviate this problem. It would also stop foxes from making the problem worse by dragging the food cartons around.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blithdale Road, Abbey Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Black Bin Liners still on the pavement, 2nd November
item.description:
Hello, ILast week I reported that once again fly tippers have dumped full bin liners on the pavement outside our home. I received an email from Southwark saying the issue had been resolved. This is not correct. The three full large bin liners are still there. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 76, Alleyn Road, Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 piles of leaves, 2nd November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 177, Croydon Road, Elmers End, London

item.title: Cars that shouldnâ€™t be parked in these bays are parking, 2nd November
item.description:
I am a permit holder and sometimes when i come home from work i cant find a place to put my car as they are all full and the disabled bays are empty but i cant use them as iam not a bluebadge holder cars that i have never seen before park here
